reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at Dorothy and Mike's on two separate occasions on our honeymoon around Haida Gwaii in September 2011. We can't say enough about them. We stayed in "Suite 2" Which had a private bath, full kitchenette, views of the ocean and a queen bed as well as a twin if needed. The place was spacious, clean, comfortable, inviting and had everything you might need to spend a night or a month. There were pictures on the wall and the suite was bright and cozy. There is coffee and tea provided. We met Mike and he went above and beyond with his hospitality by charging our dead car battery! Mike is lovely, very calm cool and collected and runs the guesthouse with his family with obvious care.
reviews.title: Your Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many options to choose from in terms of suites (sizes and prices) that run from around $80 to $130, but in order to get that choice in the summer months, book ahead! They are well known up there for good reason and fill up quickly. But even when full, the guesthouse is peaceful and each suite seems quite private. I would recommend Dorothy and Mike's to any one, at any time.
reviews.title: Lovely place with really nice people

reviews.text: Just returned from a visit to the Haida Gwaii and stayed 3 nights at Dorothy & Mike's in the 'Kumdis' room.
reviews.title: Perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with the accommodations, the view and our hosts. Didn't hear a peep from the SPCA and we were in the room right next to it.
reviews.title: Cat Approved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't see a lot of Dorothy but Mike was really helpful and petty damn funny...nice fella. Their son, Evan (?), also was also very helpful and is a pleasant young guy.
reviews.title: Not quite suite sucess

reviews.text: The Sunflower Suite at at Dorothy and Mike’s was a wonderful luxurious oasis for the three of us after a week’s trip into Gwaii Haanas under primitive conditions. We appreciated the spotless kitchen, comfortable beds, and great shower. We had stayed at Dorothy and Mike’s for two days before traveling to Gwaii Haanas and enjoyed the lovely view from the suite, the outdoor eating area, and Mike’s dry sense of humour. Breakfast is served upstairs on attractive pottery dishes, and we enjoyed chatting with the other guests. Mike went out of his way to help us with arrangements and gave us useful information about the town and the area. The B&B is centrally located and easy walking distance from the main parts of town. The airport shuttle comes right to the door. We will definitely stay here again if we come back to Queen Charlotte.
reviews.title: Pleasant and relaxing ambience

likes.liked: — The view, the comfort, the cleanliness

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay. The B&B has 9 or 10 rooms and a couple of suites. We had a corner room on the main floor with lots of windows, big screen TV and it was close to the dining room. Mike was very helpful and a great cook. Mike and Dorothy also run the local SPCA so I was able to visit with a few cats. No worries if you have allergies, however, as the cats have their own separate accomodations and are not allowed in the guest area. We had a beautiful view over the ocean and would definitely stay there again if we ever go back.
reviews.title: Best place we stayed in Haida Gwaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is half of "Bed and Breakfast", but you certainly aren't getting your money's worth when it comes to the food if you stay at Dorthy and Mike's. Mike prepared the breakfast, a very small square of quiche, a single undersized muffin, and a fruit salad. My wife noticed other guests looking around at each other in wonderment at the small portions.
reviews.title: Small breakfast, standoffish host, but nice room
disenchanted with communications
reviews.text: The room was nice. The room, and the common areas of the B&B were attractively decorated. The bedroom and bathroom were neat and clean.

reviews.title: Our Best B&B stay to date
reviews.text: We didn't meet Dorothy. As another reviewer stated, Mike is a stand-offish, cold fish kind of fellow. If you're looking for a warm connection with your host, look elsewhere.

I spent a week at this delightful guest house at the end of July. Accomodations here are clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. The hosts were attentive while at the same time respectful of personal privacy. Mike in particular went out of his way to help me find my way around the islands on my first visit. I travel to remote areas frequently and this guest house is truly a gem for anyone who wants to get away to a beautiful remote island without sacrificing all the comforts of home.
reviews.title: This guest house is a gem. It's at the top of my short list.

reviews.text: To be properly appreciated Dorothy and Mike's needs to be considered in context. Accommodation in Haida Gwaii is limited and of highly variable quality. During a short visit we were in one place that was delightful but quirky, another that turned out to be in the middle of a construction site when we were there, and one - not accessible by land - so primitive that it did not have a full-height door on the outhouse.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDINGLY CLEAN AND WELL MAINTAINED

reviews.text: Dorothy and Mike's, where we stayed twice, differs from the others in that is straightforwardly modern. Our unit (we were a group of six who took up one complete building) was not "romantic" but it was attractive, meticulously clean, well-maintained, and provided with a very well equipped kitchen. On our second visit, after a four day Zodiac trip, the generous bathrooms, perfectly functioning plumbing , and thick towels were cause for rejoicing. it struck us as a place that would be ideal for a family.
reviews.title: Nice decor, but not so friendly host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were nice, but one wonders why people choose to run a guest house, when they do not seem to appreciate guests that much. We did not feel welcome. The rooms are nice, all new with pretty decor. There is no internet in teh cabins, only in the main house. The owners have a lot of pets, so if you are not into pets, this is not the place. We were dissappointed.
reviews.title: Best place we stayed on Haida Gwaii

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the rooms in the cottage - it was a welcome oasis after spending time in a rustic cabin on North Beach. The house is tastefully decorated, and the furnishings are all high spec and comfortable. The place was impeccably clean, and the kitchen was very well kitted out. The gardens of both the main house and cottages are lush and filled with flowers and local greenery. I found Mike to be friendly - don't know what other reviewers experienced. We didn't order a breakfast, which is catered by one of their neighbours - but it looked like a great menu and reasonably priced. Will definitely stay here again the next time we visit.
reviews.title: great place, great people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After buying breakfast supplies in the nearby convenience store, we were all set. The b&B also incorporates a shelter for cats (BCSPCA), and for the less fit crowd, there is a steep hill from the main road, about 200m along Alder Street to the entrance.
reviews.title: A comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We revisited Dorothy and Mike's on our second trip to the Haida Gwaii. This time, we stayed in the 'Sunflower Suite', a self contained kitchen suite. We could have stayed here for a month! Everything we needed was there.
reviews.title: Second verse, same as the first!

reviews.text: Had a chance to meet Dorothy this time: lovely lady. And Mike was still Mike...dry sense of humour and very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: This visit pretty much confirms D & M's as being our go-to accommodations in QCC...when you've got it this good, why would you want to stay anywhere else?
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and private guesthouse with spectacular view
Good value, great location, clean and comfortable
reviews.text: All the best,
